data.title: Feature: New logging system
data.body:
Original issue: https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/issues/149
- Old staff is marked with 'deprecated'
- There are two phases: before loading a config (default config is used)
  and after config is loaded (logger could change logging file)
- There is feature to setup verbosity levels both for outputing to
  console and outputing to file
- Configuration is loaded in error-proof manner. All values are set to
  default if config cannot find them
- Fully qualified logging section in config:

``` YAML
Game:
    Verbosity: !Verbosity High # OutputManager 
Logging: # GlobalLogger options
    FilePath: "dash.log" # Phase 2 logname
    Debug: # Is taken in debug build
        OutputVerbosity: !Verbosity High
        LoggingVerbosity: !Verbosity High
    Release: # Is taken in release build
        OutputVerbosity: !Verbosity High
        LoggingVerbosity: !Verbosity High
```

data.title: Log which Yaml file causes a dyaml Node Exception

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body: When there's a syntax error in yaml, a dyaml Node Exception is thrown.  Ideally, if the engine could log which file it failed to load (or even better, what line/node) that'd be super helpful.

data.body: This way people just starting new projects don't have to worry about creating a bunch of empty folders.

data.title: Use Default/Error Texture when Texture Not Found
data.body:
When I name a texture in a material yaml that doesn't exist in the texture folder, it should warn/notify me that the texture name I was looking for was not found, and probably use a default/error texture for that texture.

Presumably, the default/error texture should be different for diffuse, normal, and specular

data.title: Feature: Move Output module to dlogg package

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
There was a conversation in gitter about long run need for logging subsystem ([dlogg](https://github.com/NCrashed/dlogg)), thus I'd like to start work on the subject.

Notes:
- logger should be stored as global variable as currently `OutputManager` is implemented
- keep `logDebug`, `logInfo`, and e.t.c. methods, but they would be a wrappers for static logger instance
- mapping from `Verbosity` and `OutputType` enums to corresponding dlogg enums

data.title: Updated README.md
data.body: Now uses the proper link for the "Planned Features & Wish List" wiki page.

data.title: Better error handling for fbo errors

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0

## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body: If frame buffer doesn't pass check then status code is acquired which is transformed into man-readable string.

data.title: Feature: Object States
data.body:
This gives objects granular control over what updates each cycle, just like what DGame has.

Closes #143.

data.title: Feature: Forward, Up, & Right vectors
data.body: Transform now contains forward, up, and right functions to return the axes of the rotation quaternion.

data.title: Refactor: Task Module
data.body: This moves all task related things to the tasks module, and out of DGame. This will allow us to easily add more types of tasks in the future without cluttering up DGame.

data.title: Add Hide function to GameObjects

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
A game developer may want to quickly/easily stop drawing an object without losing state information (for example, objects that you would like to see through but that maybe aren't actually clipped by the hardware yet).

Note: I'm not yet confident this makes sense as a GameObject function, since not all GameObjects are drawn anyways.  Maybe make a GameObject.disable(), and then it will not draw if it has a mesh, not light things if it contains a light, etc?  Feel free to suggest.

Current Use Case:  There are pipes on the walls in a current project.  Because of that, when viewing from outside, we'd like to clip the walls.  The flat surface of the wall is clipped by backface culling, but since the pipes are round, you see them through the walls.  It'd be preferred if we could just disable drawing on walls based on the camera direction.

data.title: Feature: Debug Verbosity
data.body:
This extra level of verbosity allows you to add in messages you would use for debugging without having to bother the average user.

This also adds benchmarking to all init calls in debug mode only.

data.title: Add string parameter to Input.addKeyDownEvent

milestone.title: Version 0.7.0
milestone.description:
## Beta Release - Imagine RIT Build

The game will reach Beta with this milestone.

data.body:
I would like to be able to do .addKeyDownEvent using a string as defined in Input.yml rather than hardcoding a value.

Current: 

``` d
Input.addKeyDownEvent( Keyboard.Escape, ( uint kc ) { currentState = EngineState.Quit; } );
```

New:

``` d
Input.addKeyDownEvent( "Back", ( uint kc ) { currentState = EngineState.Quit; } );
```

data.title: Version 0.6.0
data.body:
Major changes for version 0.6.0 include mouse support, a more consistent graphics pipeline, change to GameStates, improvements to the Time utility, a transition from a GameObjectCollection to Scenes, and functional animations.

[Issues Closed](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash/issues?milestone=6&state=closed)

data.title: Feature: Animation System
data.body: Basic animation sample is animating properly.

data.title: Feature: Mouse Input
data.body:
This is the initial mouse input solution.  This will be more than sufficient for specific atomic mouse interactions for current test projects.

This solution will need to improve in order to have efficient per-frame mouse tracking, but is feature complete for the current milestone.

Closes #9.

data.title: Feature: Thread Local Time
data.body:
This makes all time calculations thread local, and more importantly adds the ability to check if a function is executing on the main thread.
Also Time.deltaTime and .totalTime are now in seconds.

Closes #129.

data.title: Optimize Name and Index Lookups for GameObjects in Scenes

data.body: Current idea: Keep a String-GameObject array and Index-GameObject array in Scene which is updated by the addChild method
